summary: This document is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (Audrey Strauss) responding to a Touhy request for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and a plaintiff (Jane Doe) in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. The letter authorizes the release of certain documents, including FedEx invoices referencing the plaintiff and materials obtained via search warrants, while citing restrictions like grand jury secrecy. This document appears to be a FedEx invoice or payment summary from February 2001, addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein at his 457 Madison Avenue address in New York. It details shipping charges and includes a list of numbered items (1-254) that are likely redacted or illegible, possibly referencing shipments or recipients. The document is subject to a protective order.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (Audrey Strauss) authorized the release of documents in response to a Touhy request related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe.
Released documents include FedEx invoices referencing the plaintiff (Jane Doe) and materials obtained via electronic and physical search warrants on Epstein.
A specific photo depicting the plaintiff was obtained through a physical search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
The DOJ cited legal restrictions, including grand jury secrecy rules (Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e)), as limiting what could be disclosed.
The document production was made in lieu of formal discovery in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al., where an initial pretrial conference was scheduled.
A FedEx invoice from February 2001 is addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein at 457 Madison Avenue, New York.
The document includes a lengthy numbered list (items 1-254), the contents of which are not legible in the provided text, suggesting possible redactions or a list of shipments/recipients.
The document is explicitly subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating it is part of sealed or restricted case materials.
